episodes.title: TuckrBox (Season 2, Episode 5)
episodes.summary:
Co-founders Meghan Carreau and Alex Payne are pitching their food delivery service built on noble ideals of making kids healthier and reducing headaches for parents. Can the founders convince investors that their startup will actually deliver on those promises?

Sponsored by

Accomplice – in a few weeks Accomplice will be doing a free webinar on the role of data in your design strategy, go to itsworthdoingright.com/webinar to register

episodes.title: Hykso (Season 2, Episode 4)
episodes.summary:
Season 2 of the pitch continues with a startup that’s making their version of a Fitbit. The founders have developed a product that they believe is going to revolutionize the fitness industry. Will investors go all in on this new hardware company, or are the risks simply too high?

Sponsored by

Accomplice – in a few weeks Accomplice will be doing a free webinar on The Role of Data in Your Design Strategy, go to itsworthdoingright.com/webinar to register

episodes.title: Tesloop (Season 2, Episode 3)
episodes.summary:
Today, we meet a founder who wants to build a fleet of Tesla taxis to shuttle passengers from city to city. His business is booming and he’s already raised a half of the million dollars he’s looking for. The only problem? He’s got to run his company between English class and Algebra.

Sponsored by

Accomplice – in a few weeks Accomplice will be doing a free webinar on The Role of Data in Your Design Strategy, go to itsworthdoingright.com/webinar to register

episodes.title: Sudden Coffee (Season 2, Episode 2)
episodes.summary:
Two co-founders are taking their shot at a 35 billion dollar market with a product they spent years refining. They think their instant coffee is going to wow investors. But is a good product enough without a great pitch?

Sponsored by

Accomplice – in a few weeks Accomplice will be doing a free webinar on the role of data in your design strategy, go to itsworthdoingright.com/webinar to register

episodes.title: Teamable (Season 2, Episode 1)
episodes.summary:
In the fall of 2016, 12 startups came to San Francisco, California. Each company founder came for one reason, to try and raise money for their startup. We followed the entrepreneurs into the room where they pitched to investors.

On today’s show, a startup founder from the east coast will pitch to five venture capitalists in San Francisco. Today’s founder has a great business but will her attitude be her own worst enemy? Some say she’s scrappy. Others say she’s cocky.

Sponsored by

Accomplice – in a few weeks Accomplice will be doing a free webinar on The Role of Data in Your Design Strategy, go to itsworthdoingright.com/webinar to register

Chris Stoikos pitches his manly subscription service to Marvin Liao, Howie Diamond and Ryan Hoover.

Dollar Beard Club is a Los Angeles based e-commerce startup that sells products to bearded men on a subscription basis. They have killer traction in the 4-months they've been live, built off the success of their YouTube videos gone viral. But is it an investable company? Listen to find out.

episodes.title: Benjamin (Episode 11)
episodes.summary:
Andrew Chapin pitches his flash deals app Benjamin to investors Anarghya Vardhana and Ryan Lawler.

Benjamin is a flash deals app that forces you to make a purchase decision in 60-seconds or less. In a space that's thick with competition from contenders like Groupon and Living Social, Benjamin in 5-months has grown to 20-thousand daily active users. But is this something that investors will find appealing? Find out on today's episode of The Pitch.

Anarghya is a VC with Maveron the consumer only VC firm, where she focuses on sourcing and investing in the top consumer tech applications of today.

Ryan is a venture partner at 500 Startups, a seed stage VC and accelerator. He formerly was a writer for TechCrunch.

episodes.title: Dollar Beard Club (Episode 10)
episodes.summary:
Chris Stoikos pitches his manly subscription service to Marvin Liao, Howie Diamond and Ryan Hoover.

Dollar Beard Club is a Los Angeles based e-commerce startup that sells products to bearded men on a subscription basis. They have killer traction in the 4-months they've been live, built off the success of their YouTube videos gone viral. But is it an investable company? Listen to find out.

Guest investors

  • Marvin Liao runs 500 Startups, a San Francisco based accelerator program that invests in seed deals and helps companies grow, reach product market fit, and find investors.
  • Howie runs Ranch Ventures, a new VC firm investing at the seed stage.
  • Ryan Hoover is the founder of Product Hunt and knows more about building a scalable consumer company than most, so we thought we'd get his take as well.

Resources mentioned

  • Dollar Beard Club on YouTube
  • Dollar Shave Club
  • Birchbox
  • Winestyr Wine Club—$33 off (sponsor)

Our guest co-host today is Michael Sacca with The Rocketship Podcast.

episodes.title: Videopath (Episode 9)
episodes.summary:
Anna Rose pitches her video annotations product to investors Josh Maher and Seth Levine.

Videopath is a Berlin based startup that adds interactivity to online videos. Their freemium SaaS product is designed for content marketers and brands. They have early traction in Europe and now they are looking to expand into the US.

Josh Maher is the president of Seattle Angel and the author of the book Startup Wealth. His new book presents 23 different successful approaches to investing in early stage companies for entrepreneurs and investors alike.

Seth Levine is the cofounder and managing partner of Foundry Group where they invest across the technology landscape. Typically in companies that are raising their first institutional capital and have previously raised less than $3M. They invest in 'themes' which are long term technology trends that they've identified as having the potential for many successful investments.

episodes.title: Ironclad (Episode 8)
episodes.summary:
Jason Boehmig pitches his automated assistant for legal paperwork, Ironclad to investors Michael Cardamone, Mar Hershenson & Neil Devani.

Guest Investors

  • Michael Cardamone, managing director at Acceleprise, the SaaS incubator.
  • Mar Hershenson, managing partner of Pejman Mar Ventures, where they invest in very early stage tech startups.
  • Neil Devani, investor and GC at Rothenberg Ventures, where they invest in early stage companies with a focus on frontier technologies.

episodes.title: Havenly (Episode 7)
episodes.summary:
Lee Mayer pitches her online interior design service Havenly to Phil Nadel, Millie Tadewaldt & Nikhil Kalghatgi. If you want to try out Havenly, use code THEPITCH during checkout for a 20% discount.

Guest investors are Nikhil Kalghatgi, partner at Vast Ventures, Millie Tadewaldt from AngelList, and Phil Nadel who cofounded Barbara Corcoran Venture Partners with Barbara from Shark Tank.

episodes.title: Coins.ph (Episode 6)
episodes.summary:

Sheel's recommended books for raising seed funding

  • The Lean Startup: How Today's Entrepreneurs Use Continuous Innovation to Create Radically Successful Businesses

  • The Closer's Survival Guide

episodes.title: New Story (Episode 5)
episodes.summary:
Brett and Allie pitch their nonprofit startup New Story to Brad Feld of Foundry Group, Zanoon Nissar of Google, and Premal Shah of Kiva.org.

We like what these guys are doing so much that we want to see if we can collectively fund a home for a family in need. We'd love for you to donate to the campaign; Let's build Clairmita a home for her family! campaign.newstorycharity.org/the-pitch

episodes.title: RocketClub (Episode 4)
episodes.summary: Erik and Paul pitch their startup RocketClub to Sara Thomas of Maven Ventures and Jacob Chapman of Sazze Partners. RocketClub helps early-stage companies get traction by giving away small amounts of equity (1-2%) to 500-1000 early product champions.

episodes.title: Publet (Episode 3)
episodes.summary: MJ Coren pitches his PDF killer for enterprise, Publet to Cyan Banister and Mesh Lakhani.

episodes.title: Flair (Episode 2)
episodes.summary: Dan Myers pitches his internet-of-things startup Flair to Nick Moran, Jason Heltzer and Charlie O'Donnell. Dan and his cofounder, Kenny just shipped their first beta units, but now they're ready to roll their smart vents out to the market. But they need investors to come on board first.

episodes.title: Chameleon (Episode 1)
episodes.summary: Pulkit Agrawal pitches his onboarding-as-a-service startup, Chameleon to Dave McClure and Mahendra Ramsinghani.

episodes.title: Why The Pitch
episodes.summary: Josh and Sheel talk about what's going on behind the scenes right now and why they believe this podcast should exist.
